Tolkien-related events that took place in 1953.

content.title: February
content.content:
9 - Actor Ciarán Hinds is born.
11 - Wayne G. Hammond is born.

content.title: March
content.content:
11 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 135d.
24 - J.R.R. Tolkien meets Rayner Unwin in Oxford[1] and then writes letter 136 to his father, Stanley Unwin.
30 - J.R.R. Tolkien and Edith move to 76 Sandfield Road.

content.title: April
content.content:
11 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 137.
15 - J.R.R. Tolkien gives the W.P. Ker Lecture at Glasgow University on the religious themes adultery, temptation and repentance in Sir Gawain and the Green Knight.
21 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 137a.

content.title: June
content.content:
5 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 137b.
5 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 137c.
11 - Pearl, edited by E.V. Gordon and including a contribution by J.R.R. Tolkien, is published.
22 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 137d.
24 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to George Sayer.
27 - Actress Lorri Holt is born.
? - Christopher Gilson, linguist, is born.

content.title: July
content.content:
? (mid-month) - J.R.R. Tolkien receives galley-proofs of the first volume from Allen and Unwin; he realised that some words have been over-corrected (dwarves to dwarfs, elvish to elfish, further to farther, and worst of all, elven to elfin).[2]
8 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 137e.
28 - Rayner Unwin presses Tolkien to choose titles for each volume for Lord of the Rings; he erroneously proposes that the general title should belong to the first volume.[3][4]

content.title: August
content.content:
4 – J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 138.
8 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 139.
15 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Ronald Eames.
17 - J.R.R. Tolkien agrees with Rayner Unwin on the volume titles for the book: they will be The Fellowship of the Ring, The Two Towers and (reluctantly) The Return of the King.
31 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 140a.

content.title: September
content.content:
3 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 140b.
8 - Actor John McGlynn is born.
23 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 140c.

content.title: October
content.content:
4 - Actor Chris Fairbank is born.
9 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 141.
15 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 141a.
? - Essays and Studies 1953, including The Homecoming of Beorhtnoth Beorhthelm's Son by J.R.R. Tolkien, is published.

content.title: November
content.content:
19 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 141b.
23 - Composer Johan de Meij is born.
30 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 141c.

content.title: December
content.content:
1 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 141d.
2 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 142.
4 - An issue of the magazine Radio Times featuring an article by J.R.R. Tolkien, is published.
5 - Actor Christopher Guard is born.
10 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 142a.
28 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Rayner Unwin.
29 - J.R.R. Tolkien visits Allen & Unwin at Museum Street in London.

? - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 135b.
? - Essais de philologie moderne (1951), including the essay "Middle English 'Losenger'" by J.R.R. Tolkien, is published.
Late - Christopher Tolkien draws General Map of Middle-earth.[5]
